original: Eriksson, John Erik, adjunkt, Kalmar, f. 22/7/03 i Haverö, Västern. 1., av Jonas E. o. Alma Ahlman. G. 36 m. Lisa Bäck. Barn: Sture f. 37, Bengt 39, Olof 44, Inger 47. — Fil. mag. i Upps. 30, ’S tyrm: ex. 33, ’sj ökap t :ex. 34, navig : -skoilhex. 35, sjökapt :brev 37. Stud:-resa t. Prag 28-29, i tj. s. styrm. berest hamnar i Eur., Amer., Afr. o. Aus’tr. 34-38. Akad. adj :tj. v. navig :’sk. i Härnösand 37-45, adj. v. navig :isk. i Kalm. fr. 45. V. ol. tillf, underv. i navig. v. isjövärnskåren o. i matem, o. elektroteicn. v. yrkessk. Medl. i Navig :sk. där:fören. fr. 43, Kalm. sjö- kapt :giHe fr. 45. Skr.: grafiskt arb. i nav. f. lektorstj. v. navigisk. Hob-bies: skidsport, trä- o. metallsilöjd.
translated: Eriksson, John Erik, teacher, Kalmar, b. July 22, 1903 in Haverö, Westerners Land, son of Jonas E. and Alma Ahlman. Married in 1936 to Lisa Bäck. Children: Sture b. 1937, Bengt b. 1939, Olof b. 1944, Inger b. 1947. Earned a Bachelor of Arts degree from Uppsala University in 1930, passed the qualifying examination for navigating in 1933, the second mate examination in 1934, the navigation school exam in 1935, and received a ship captain's license in 1937. Made a study trip to Prague in 1928-1929, and traveled to various ports in Europe, America, Africa and Australia as second mate from 1934-1938. Assistant teacher of navigation school in Härnösand from 1937-1945 and assistant teacher of navigation school in Kalmar since 1945. Temporary instructor in navigation in the naval reserve and in mathematics and electronics at vocational school. Member of the Navigation Society since 1943 and of the Kalmar Seamanship Guild since 1945. Authors of graphic works in naval education as a lecturer in navigation. Hobbies include skiing, wood and metalwork.

structured.name: John Erik Eriksson

structured.description: John Erik Eriksson (1903-07-22) was a Swedish teacher and navigator. He earned a Bachelor of Arts degree from Uppsala University in 1930, passed the qualifying examination for navigating in 1933, the second mate examination in 1934, the navigation school exam in 1935, and received a ship captain's license in 1937. He was an assistant teacher of navigation school in Härnösand from 1937-1945 and assistant teacher of navigation school in Kalmar since 1945. He was a temporary instructor in navigation in the naval reserve and in mathematics and electronics at vocational school. He was a member of the Navigation Society since 1943 and of the Kalmar Seamanship Guild since 1945. His hobbies included skiing, wood and metalwork.
